text: Hello everyone. This is Minoo at Anglo-Link.
Welcome to Lesson 10 in my EZEE series.

As you know, we're going to fix 
some more common errors
to increase your confidence in speaking English.
Remember that mistakes are a natural part of the learning process,

so make sure you never apologise 
for making mistakes,
especially when you're learning a complicated language like English.
Today's lesson is about words that end in 's'
but are not plural, like 'series', 'news', and 'headquarters'.
So, which one is correct:
'this news' or 'these news'?

Let's look at some slides together to find out 
the answer.
Well, that is the end of Lesson 10.

I hope you now feel fully confident to use 
these common words.
If you sometimes doubt whether to use a singular or a plural verb,

visit my YouTube channel and look for 
the video 'Subject-Verb Agreement'.

You can also 
use the link at the end of this video.
Also, make sure you check out my online self-study course
for a wide range of oral and written exercises to improve your grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation.
You can join my course by visiting my website
anglo-link.com.

And, please remember to subscribe to 
my channel and allow notifications
to know when my next lesson is available.
Thank you for watching, and I'll see you again very soon.
Goodbye for now.
